priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Mechanical Circulatory Support Placement Timing Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C101845

self.title: CDISC SDTM Mechanical Circulatory Support Placement Timing Terminology

definition: A terminology codelist to describe the timing of mechanical circulatory support placement.
name: Mechanical Circulatory Support Placement Timing
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Mechanical Circulatory Support Placement Timing Terminology

terms.definition: Mechanical Circulatory Support was in place at the start of the procedure.
terms.preferredTerm: Mechanical Circulatory Support in Place at Start of Procedure
terms.submissionValue: IN PLACE AT START OF PROCEDURE
synonyms: In Place at Start of Procedure

terms.definition: Mechanical Circulatory Support was inserted during a non-Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) procedure.
terms.preferredTerm: Inserted During a Non-Percutaneous Coronary Intervention
terms.submissionValue: INSERTED DURING A NON-PERCUTANEOUS CORONARY INTERVENTION PROCEDURE
synonyms: Inserted during a Non PCI Procedure

terms.definition: Mechanical Circulatory Support was inserted during the procedure after Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) started.
terms.preferredTerm: Inserted During Procedure and After Percutaneous Coronary Intervention Began
terms.submissionValue: INSERTED DURING PROCEDURE AND AFTER PERCUTANEOUS CORONARY INTERVENTION STARTED
synonyms: Inserted during Procedure and after PCI Started

terms.definition: Mechanical Circulatory Support was inserted during the procedure prior to percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI).
terms.preferredTerm: Inserted During a Procedure but Prior to Percutaneous Coronary Intervention
terms.submissionValue: INSERTED DURING PROCEDURE BUT PRIOR TO PERCUTANEOUS CORONARY INTERVENTION
synonyms: Inserted during Procedure but Prior to PCI
